main event: A military observer reported seeing a single stationary object in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on September 9, 1965.
interesting points: The object was first seen as a reflection in the observer's car windshield as he was leaving the Wright-Patterson AFB club.
The object appeared to be about 6 feet in diameter when first observed, but diminished in size to the 'size of a small cocktail glass' by the time the observer reached the Sears parking lot.
The sighting occurred at the same time as a major power failure on the northeast coast of the United States.
The observer compared the brightness of the object to the lower light of a car.
The object faded from sight and disappeared from view.
